description: Silent Hill 2 is a seminal work in the history of video games, basically being the go-to example of most gamers for when someone wants to say that the medium can produce genuine art alongside The Last of Us. Silent Hill 2’s reputation has far exceeded its initial release and grown in the retelling, ignoring a lot of the original 2001 release’s flaws ranging from janky controls to sometimes questionable voice acting from everyone but Guy Cihi and Monica Taylor Horgan. The HD re-release of Silent Hill 2 also got a poor reputation despite the fact that Mary Elizabeth McGlynn was in it and I’d play anything with her. For grimdark fans, Silent Hill 2 is a fantastic game as it is one of the rare ones that is willing to cast aside the usual hero narrative. title: REVIEW: Silent Hill 2 (Remake)
